member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.ClientProxyExtensions.SendAsync(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.IClientProxy,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Invokes a method on the connection(s) represented by the instance. Does not wait for a response from the receiver.
member.param: The name of the method to invoke.
The token to monitor for cancellation requests. The default value is .
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous invoke.

member.summary: A default in-memory lifetime manager abstraction for instances.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DefaultUserIdProvider
member.summary: The default provider for getting the user ID from a connection. This provider gets the user ID from the connection's name identifier claim.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHub
member.summary: A base class for SignalR hubs that use dynamic to represent client invocations.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHub.Clients
member.summary: Gets or sets an object that can be used to invoke methods on the clients connected to this hub.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients
member.summary: A class that provides dynamic access to connections, including the one that sent the current invocation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.IHubCallerClients)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A wrapped that is used to invoke methods.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.All
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all clients connected to the hub.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods on the specified user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.AllExcept(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all clients connected to the hub excluding the specified connections.
member.param: A collection of connection IDs to exclude.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods on the specified user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Caller
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on the connection which triggered the current invocation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Client(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on the specified connection.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Clients(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on the specified connections.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Group(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all connections in the specified group.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Groups(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all connections in all of the specified groups.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods on the specified user.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.GroupExcept(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all connections in the specified group excluding the specified connections.
member.param: A collection of connection IDs to exclude.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.OthersInGroup(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on connections in a group other than the caller.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Others
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on connections other than the caller.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.User(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all connections associated with the specified user.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.DynamicHubClients.Users(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{System.String})
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to invoke methods on all connections associated with all of the specified users.
member.returns: An object that can be used to invoke methods.

member.summary: A base class for a SignalR hub.

member.summary: Gets or sets an object that can be used to invoke methods on the clients connected to this hub.

member.summary: Gets or sets the hub caller context.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Hub.Groups
member.summary: Gets or sets the group manager.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Hub.OnConnectedAsync
member.summary: Called when a new connection is established with the hub.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous connect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Hub.OnDisconnectedAsync(System.Exception)
member.summary: Called when a connection with the hub is terminated.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous disconnect.

member.name: M:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.Hub.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases all resources currently used by this instance.
member.param: true if this method is being invoked by the method, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubCallerContext
member.summary: A context abstraction for accessing information about the hub caller connection.

member.summary: Gets the connection ID.

member.summary: Gets the user identifier.

member.summary: Gets the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubCallerContext.Items
member.summary: Gets a key/value collection that can be used to share data within the scope of this connection.

member.summary: Gets the collection of HTTP features available on the connection.

member.summary: Gets a that notifies when the connection is aborted.

member.name: T:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions
member.summary: Options used to configure hub instances.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.HandshakeTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval used by the server to timeout incoming handshake requests by clients. The default timeout is 15 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.KeepAliveInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval used by the server to send keep alive pings to connected clients. The default interval is 15 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.ClientTimeoutInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the time window clients have to send a message before the server closes the connection. The default timeout is 30 seconds.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.SupportedProtocols
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of supported hub protocol names.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.MaximumReceiveMessageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum message size of a single incoming hub message. The default is 32KB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.EnableDetailedErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether detailed error messages are sent to the client. Detailed error messages include details from exceptions thrown on the server.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.StreamBufferCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the max buffer size for client upload streams. The default size is 10.

member.name: P:Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR.HubOptions.MaximumParallelInvocationsPerClient
member.summary: By default a client is only allowed to invoke a single Hub method at a time. Changing this property will allow clients to invoke multiple methods at the same time before queueing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.ObjectMethodExecutor.Execute(System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the configured method on . This can be used whether or not the configured method is asynchronous.
member.remarks: Even if the target method is asynchronous, it's desirable to invoke it using Execute rather than ExecuteAsync if you know at compile time what the return type is, because then you can directly "await" that value (via a cast), and then the generated code will be able to reference the resulting awaitable as a value-typed variable. If you use ExecuteAsync instead, the generated code will have to treat the resulting awaitable as a boxed object, because it doesn't know at compile time what type it would be.
member.param: The object whose method is to be executed.
Parameters to pass to the method.
member.returns: The method return value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.ObjectMethodExecutor.ExecuteAsync(System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the configured method on . This can only be used if the configured method is asynchronous.
member.remarks:
If you don't know at compile time the type of the method's returned awaitable, you can use ExecuteAsync, which supplies an awaitable-of-object. This always works, but can incur several extra heap allocations as compared with using Execute and then using "await" on the result value typecasted to the known awaitable type. The possible extra heap allocations are for:
1. The custom awaitable (though usually there's a heap allocation for this anyway, since normally it's a reference type, and you normally create a new instance per call). 2. The custom awaiter (whether or not it's a value type, since if it's not, you need a new instance of it, and if it is, it will have to be boxed so the calling code can reference it as an object). 3. The async result value, if it's a value type (it has to be boxed as an object, since the calling code doesn't know what type it's going to be).
member.param: The object whose method is to be executed.
Parameters to pass to the method.
member.returns: An object that you can "await" to get the method return value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.ObjectMethodExecutorAwaitable
member.summary: Provides a common awaitable structure that can return, regardless of whether the underlying value is a System.Task, an FSharpAsync, or an application-defined custom awaitable.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Internal.ObjectMethodExecutorFSharpSupport
member.summary: Helper for detecting whether a given type is FSharpAsync`1, and if so, supplying an for mapping instances of that type to a C# awaitable.
member.remarks: The main design goal here is to avoid taking a compile-time dependency on FSharp.Core.dll, because non-F# applications wouldn't use it. So all the references to FSharp types have to be constructed dynamically at runtime.
